data.title: Grades Operations
data.statement:
Given a list of numbers: calculate the {{average}} and/or the {{median}} and/or the {{range}}.

A few hints:
- {{average}}: sum of values / number of values
- {{median}}: The middle number in a sorted list of numbers. If the list has an even number of elements, the median is the average of the two middle numbers.
- {{range}}: difference between the highest and lowest values
data.stubGenerator:
read grades:string(100)
read requirements:string(25)

write answer
data.inputDescription:
<<Line 1>>: A string with [[grades]] integers each separated by a space.
<<Line 2>>: A string with [[requirements]] of up to 3 words (average, median, range) each separated by a space, indicating the order in which the given values should be printed.
data.outputDescription: <<Line 1>>: A string with [[numbers]] each separated by a space, representing the values asked in entry, that is the average and/or median and/or range. The values should be rounded to 2 decimal places.

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

Given a list of numbers: calculate the average and/or the median and/or the range.

A few hints:
- average: sum of values / number of values
- median: The middle number in a sorted list of numbers. If the list has an even number of elements, the median is the average of the two middle numbers.
- range: difference between the highest and lowest values
Input
Line 1: A string with grades integers each separated by a space.
Line 2: A string with requirements of up to 3 words (average, median, range) each separated by a space, indicating the order in which the given values should be printed.
Output
Line 1: A string with numbers each separated by a space, representing the values asked in entry, that is the average and/or median and/or range. The values should be rounded to 2 decimal places.
Constraints
-30 ≤ each integer in grades ≤ 30
Example
Input
17 18 2 0 4 16 10 1 9 11 0 23
average
Output
9.25
